Services sector growth accelerates in February backed by strong demandHSBC's final India services Purchasing Managers' Index, compiled by S&P Global, rose to 59.0 in February from January's 26-month low of 56.5 but was lower than a preliminary estimate of 61.1.

Sensex surges 800 points. Why is the stock market rising today?Today's rebound has brought much-needed relief to traders on Dalal Street, reviving hopes of a broader recovery in the days ahead. Here's what's driving the rally and whether the downturn has bottomed out.

K-pop group SEVENTEEN member Wonwoo to enlist in military in AprilSEVENTEEN's Wonwoo is set to begin his mandatory military service in April, as confirmed by Pledis Entertainment.

Lollapalooza 2025: Shawn Mendes, Louis Tomlinson to make India debutLollapalooza India is making a grand return in 2025 at Mumbai's Mahalaxmi Racecourse. With an eclectic lineup featuring Green Day, Shawn Mendes, and more, this festival promises an unforgettable musical experience.

She clarified that her weight gain was due to medication and urged trolls to stop their unwarranted comments.

Bobby Deol had a vertigo attack while promoting Aashram: Was very nervousActor Bobby Deol recently revealed that he suffered from a vertigo attack while promoting his popular show Aashram. The actor is currently seen in the latest season of the show, which is streaming on MX Player.

Explained: The plagiarism controversy around BLACKPINK's Jennie's new song BLACKPINK member Jennie Kim released the teaser of her new single, 'Like Jennie', on social media, and several social media users, especially Indians, found it quite similar to Alia Bhatt's theme song from 'Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani'.

general news.headline: Wasn't aware of any of it: Karnataka top cop on actor daughter's arrestKarnataka DGP Ramachandra Rao, the father of actor Ranya Rao, distanced himself from his daughter's gold smuggling case, saying he was unaware of it. The Kannada actor was caught with over 14 kg gold worth Rs 12 crore from Bengaluru airport.

Canada takes US to world trade body over Trump's 'unjustified tariffs'Donald Trump's 25 per cent tariff on goods imported from Canada, one of the US's biggest trading partners, came into effect on Tuesday.

Tamil couples can't make babies fast enough to please Stalin or save Lok Sabha seatsSaying that Tamil Nadu might lose parliamentary seats as it successfully controlled population growth, Chief Minister MK Stalin has urged couples to have babies without delay. Statistically speaking, can Tamil couples actually add babies to the population at the rate and in the duration that Stalin seeks?

Send Abu Azmi to UP, we'll take care of rest: Yogi Aditayanath to Samajwadi PartyYogi Adityanath asked the Samajwadi Party to expel Abu Azmi and send him to Uttar Pradesh. "We know well how to deal with such people," he said after row over Azmi's Aurangzeb comment.

Sleeping single, staying married: The rise of sleep divorce in IndiaOver 70% of Indian couples opt for sleep divorce to improve rest, citing snoring, stress, and mismatched schedules - highlighting a global sleep crisis impacting health and relationships, according to a study.

Biju Babu's birthday takes battle turn, BJD and Congress pounce on BJPThe BJP government of Odisha's move to delink Biju Patnaik's birth anniversary from Panchayati Raj Day and cancel the state holiday has sparked a political firestorm in the coastal state. Why ghosts of 2022 talks might return to haunt ZelenskyyJust weeks after Russia invaded Ukraine in February 2022, officials from both sides met in Belarus and Turkey for peace talks. The negotiations fell through. Three years later, after losing territory and thousands of people, Ukraine might find terms of peace much more difficult to settle. This comes as Russia digs in amid US President Donald Trump withdrawing war support for Kyiv.

Exclusive: Terror outfit Jaish's headquarter expands in 'whitelisted' PakistanIn October 2022, FATF removed Pakistan from its Grey List for improving counter-terror financing, even as Jaish-e-Mohammed's Bahawalpur base was undergoing major expansion.

Kiara Advani exits Don 3 after announcing pregnancyActor Kiara Advani announced her pregnancy earlier this year. Now, the 33-year-old has left Farhan Akhtar's 'Don 3', which also features Ranveer Singh as the lead.

Tinder's in-app survey reveals a growing preference for meaningful connections, safety, and authenticity over traditional dating norms.

FIFA president confirms half-time show in finalFIFA president Gianni Infantino has confirmed that the football World Cup 2026 will have a first of its kind halftime show in the final of the tournament. NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.
